comments.body:
`util` is a bad package name according to:
https://blog.golang.org/package-names

I know we've got util sprinkled across our code base, but is it worth avoiding introducing more? These are both related to formatting and pods, so it could be either "format" or "pod" or even methods on a *Pod or PodList ?

@mbforbes, I'm okay with changing to a different package name. "pod" is not a good name since this file may include non-pod objects in the future. I could use "format" if other reviewers agree, or simply merge it to the existing types package (which is again not very unique).

Just a side node, I need this file to be in a separate package so that we could use it for logging in other packages under the kubelet directory.
"format" sounds like a good name, then. (Also if this is too much of a slowdown feel free to ignore and we can do some cleanup later.)
